intro: Dorstenia quercifolia, commonly known as the "Oak-leafed Dorstenia," is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves that resemble the shape of an oak leaf, hence its common name. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are often clustered in cymes. Dorstenia quercifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
